Summary: Super nice staff, bedding, great fluffy pillows!!! It was quiet, good insulation, just barely a hum of traffic as it’s central ...close to a bank and restaurants and to everything! Second review because it was just as clean and welcoming as last time. Keep up the great work!

So clean and spacious with huge fluffy beds and pillows. The staff were so nice. Malu on reception was so accommodating and lovely! (I hope I’ve spelled her name correctly!) It was quiet and nearby lots of eateries and markets, very convenient and central. The bathroom was so clean! I really enjoyed my stay and would highly recommend!! :)

Very unsafe hotel. Due to ongoing fighting and disturbances my wife and I fled the hotel at 2 AM fearing for our life. We called the front desk twice and they did nothing. Stayed a few hours on a 2 night stay and no refund or call back from the manager. There is a glass barrier on check in keeping hotel staff safe from the people in the lobby. I should have realized this was an unsafe place then. Do not go here if you are concerned for your well being! They will leave you on your own and refuse to give you a refund or even call back.
Room tip: Do not stay here if you value your safety

Summary: We stayed last week for 3 days 2 nights. We have never stayed at a Rodeway Inn before, our expectation was low, we know it is not the Ritz. We arrived very early 11.am and were able to check in, put out stuff in the room and hit the beach!!!!   Thank you. We were in 205 one of only 2 suites they have, (not really a suite just a larger room) We were only there to sleep and shower, while on a 3 day beach getaway, so it was just about ok. No breakfast due to covid, if they did have breakfast you would need to take it back to your room. TV in our room was tiny? no big deal we were there for the beach, not to watch TV. Parking was fine, you need your room key to get ice from the machine, (never seen that before) San Clemente was a great little town, pier/beach area just a 10 min

COULD be nice. Once front desk staff, once check in experience.  BUT, only one tiny shampoo bottle. Not enough for two people. Internet came and went, overall poor. And NO breakfast. Yes, its covid times, but that's just an excuse for many companies to stop doing what they should do. They STILL charge the same price, there is no discount given, yet there is no breakfast provided. They could even deliver muffins to the room and some fruit if they dont want you to touch things. These little things, some breaky, some better wifi, some toiletries, are what makes a stay pleasurable versus antagonizing. Their price is on the high side compared to similar Roadways, so these things are expected. And when they are cheap, makes you wonder....do they clean the bedspreads?

Rooms were very clean and having a refrigerator was helpful. Parking garage had enough clearance for our pickup canopy. Walking distance to the beach and to Old Town. I forgot my purse in the room and we called and they held it until we could return. So nice!

Stayed here for 15 days during the month of July and really enjoyed the place. Friendly owners and the room was spacious. Clean accommodations and the only thing remotely negative is from time to parking is full. Not a huge deal as you can park across the street but just a heads up. Will definitely stay again when in the area.

Summary Heading: Not worth it--very lacking in basics
Summary: When I pay $120 plus tax, high season or low season....I expect a few things....like decaf coffee, which they didn't put in my room or in front. When I came to their breskfast, there was nothing to speak of, no fruit at all.....a big bowl of ice which MIGHT have had something in it, I'm not sure. Rooms werent that great, just normal rooms. If it was in the  $70 range, it would be ok.

I would not recommend this hotel! We booked 3 rooms. (3 couples with kids) We stayed here to save some money. San Clemente is an adorable beach town but definitely spring for a better hotel. The staff was not friendly in any way. The lady at the front desk literally argued with a customer when he asked for a different room because the one he was in smelled like smoke and he requested a non-smoking room. My brother's room had several roaches in there and they only offered to come up and spray. Our room was never cleaned - beds were never made and had a strange stain on the sheets. The breakfast was continental yes but the eating area is the lobby with no seating. San Clemente yes Rodeway Inn NO!

Hotel was rather dirty, did not make up our room at all. Had stains on the bedding. Breakfast was very limited. Not close enough to the water and not very close to the trolley stops. Have to walk a way for food as well, not ideal with younger children.

Nothing wrong with the place. Have garage parking that is free. Nice location between the beach and downtown. Breakfast is minimal with just bagels and pastries. Rooms are dated but clean. Microwave and fridge long with a safe. Would recommend for a value stay.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for, except breakfast!
Summary: It’s cheap for the area and that’s why I booked it. The room was clean and well kept.  The staff were fine, didn’t really see them much. On the first morning I searched for breakfast and found some coffee and pre packaged pastry thing! I asked where the ‘continental’ breakfast was, this was it! After this I didn’t bother.  The area is good for transport links both back up to L.A. and down to San Diego. The beach and beach trail are close by.  I’d probably stay again if they give the option of taking $10 a night off for not having breakfast!

Summary Heading: Horribly Rude Staff- Should Not Be/Go There!
Summary: If it were possible NO stars would be my rating. Horrible service with argumentative staff. When I wasn't happy they just want to be mean and unhelpful. I have nothing nice to say about this hotel. I just made a huge mistake choosing them because they had the lowest rates in the area. Now I know why.

Not a Hilton but for the price was not expecting a Hilton. The room was large, clean and quiet. Bed was comfortable. The San Clemente Pier and central San Clemente Beach was .9 miles away. Did kill a few small ants, were not bitten, but other than that no complaints.

Do not think you are getting a steal for the price. The price you are paying is accurate for the hotel. Do not book this hotel based on getting a free breakfast. It is a sad free breakfast. Coffee, tea, packaged breakfast rolls, breakfast bars and oatmeal. That’s it that’s all. No fruit no cereal no yogurt none of the other things you may get for a free breakfast at other budget friendly locations. WiFi was ok. Room clean but sparse. Good tv. Not that close to the beach. Fridge and microwave in room. There are also no trash cans in common areas, no ashtrays,  and no water fountain anywhere (I wanted to fill a water bottle). There is an ice machine and vending (you can buy water bottles) Parking was fine.

Summary Heading: Clean, well kept, great location, fantastic price
Summary: Came to San Clemente on a quick family vacation (wife and one infant). Was not expecting much at this low relative price point and with this particular brand, however, we were pleasantly surprised.   This location is well managed and maintained. The franchisor / management seems to put some TLC into the property (increasingly rare!) Everything worked well and furnishings / electronics were in good working condition. Free basic breakfast, free internet and ample free parking (inside garage as well as outside parking) was a cherry on top of this great rate. Overall great experience - no complaints. Look forward to coming back. Well done.

Room was OK and the common areas were not so clean. Thought I was saving money with a "free breakfast" but the coffee was awful, the danish preserved in plastic, breakfast bars and no fruit.  I highly recommend Antoine's Cafe for a quality breakfast.

Summary Heading: Worst Hotel I’ve stayed in EVER
Summary: Ok so it has a good location and a big room! That’s about it. When i arrived early the guy said the room wasn’t ready which is fair enough so I asked if I could leave my bag whilst I took a walk around town he said no, then I asked if I could use the bathroom, nope! It was even the way he says no like he doesn’t care he isn’t being helpful! Finally got checked in and had to pay 1.62 dollars for the safe, how did they even come up with that number?  Room is very very basic. Breakfast is pathetic, little plastic cheap breakfast rolls, cereal bars and bad tea and coffee. I can’t eat gluten so was hoping for some fruit at least but no fruit again the guy couldn’t have cared less! Don’t stay here! Rubbish hotel with even worse customer service

Once in my room, I examined the bill and noticed that I'd been charged a little more than agreed. I went back to the reception and spoke to the American lady who informed me that it was a charge to have a safe in the room. She said, 'Oh didn't I mention the charge when you checked in?'. Erm, no she didn't, but she did remember to tell me the other important information, such as check out time and breakfast. An additional charge for a safe is utter nonsense. What next...will you be taking a shower Sir? that will be an additional $5. Are you likely to use the toilet Sir? it's $1 per flush and if you use paper there will be an additional charge or 10 cents per sheet. Come on management, this is penny pinching and pure greed.

I checked in late on a Friday night and Lois was very pleasant. She gave me recommendations on restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. We went to the Mexican place up the hill and it was great. Our room was much larger than I expected and very clean. I wasn't expecting anything spectacular for the price we paid; so i was pleasantly surprised with how nice our room was.The shower was amazing, lots of pressure! The room was cleaned every day while we were out. The hotel was very quiet through the weekend. There was plenty of parking in the garage or on the main level.  Perfect location near the outlet mall and restaurants. If we return to that area again, we will definitely stay here again.

I was. Very pleased with their accommodation. Very pleasant front desk lady named Lois help me check in and gave me options of what floor and room I would prefer.  I asked where the nearest movie theater was and she happily gave me directions to it.  The room was clean and very spacious. The staff was quiet and gave me the privacy I needed when I slept in. Parking was convenient and safe. The parking garage gave me that peace of mind that my vehicle is out of danger.  I would stay there again if I visit again.  The only suggestion I do have is they need to up their free breakfast selection.  Overall very nice place for a quick visit and stay in San Clemente.  I will recommend them to people.

Large clean,quiet room   very nice budget hotel   staff was average  not overly friendly  some what helpful   parking lot and ramp right down the street   Location was okay  coffee and packaged  rolls for breakfast  Decent place to stay  nothing special

Summary Heading: Nice room for those on a budget
Summary: Very good, large, clean, fairly quiet room with a great location in San Clemente.  Staff always greeted with a smile.  Not the Ritz but isn't trying to be and for anyone on a budget, definitely recommend.  Would stay here again without hesitation.

The room was large, pretty clean and quiet.  It was nice to have cabe TV including HBO and Star.  The room and hotel is very dated.  Bed linens and towels are low quality and the pillows are small sofa pillows.  The ice machine which was ancient had no ice.  I understand that this is a budget motel (we paid $177/nt) and expectations should be lower.  The place is ok in a pinch but if given a choice I would not go back.

Loved the way we were welcomed by a smile, and treated as important guests by all the staff.  We arrived early, and accommodated immediately.  We stayed three nights in room 405 which was huge and sits on the corner of the hotel.  This room had a couch and a nice balcony where you could see the ocean in the distance. It is on a busy street, but high enough that the traffic did not bother us.  Not a fancy hotel, but great price and had more of a family atmosphere, than a party crowd.  Free parking upstairs and free covered parking downstairs.  We did not have any trouble finding a place to park.  Very close to Doheny Beach, Dana Point and plenty of places to eat.  Continental breakfast is boxed juice, coffee and packaged danish, but the size of the room, price and location make

We spend July 4th weekend there and we were surprised how big and clean our room was. There is sufficient parking even the receptionist told us it was fully booked. However, don't plan on eating breakfast there. May be you can grab a danish on your way out to breakfast. Overall, we are quite satisfied with our stay.

NEVER LEAVE YOUR ITEMS BEHIND HERE I did and they went missing within 24!hours after departure.   Would not recommend  To anyone , someone took my fee left behind treasures  I left a couple things in my dresser, when I realized that was the case and I called them within a day and the girl at the front desk said NO WE DID NOT FIND ANYTHING IN YOUR ROOM.  a couple days later I got a call saying we found your things , I picked them up but 2 of my very beautiful expensive blouses were GONE.    hmmmm.   Someone should fess up!

Yes this place is old , it has been refurbished. But let me tell you , I have stayed in 300.00 hotels that were not as clean. Housekeeping at this place is on point!! In my book, that's 5 stars!  Stayed in room 314. It was quiet had a view to ocean. Beds were good, no lumps or springs, sheets were fresh. Bathroom was clean, no hair anywhere. Easy walking to beach if you know how to get there, also it's a hill to climb to get back to hotel. But you can park and walk everywhere. Their breakfast options are meh, danish , bagels, oatmeal. But the clean room more than makes up for the other things. Check in and out was easy and nice people. I have to say, I will stay here again if I need a place to stay. Thank you to the amazing staff at this location!! You rocked it!! Keep up the

Summary Heading: Old Style Beach Town Budget Motel
Summary: Budget motel on El Camino Real but walkable to the beach if you know the way. My room was small and fronted on the main street. So there was street noise, particularly during the day. But it was comfortable. Parking is available but it could get cramped if the motel is full. But free street parking aside the motel is also available 24/7. Also, watch out for the added safe fee. If you don't use the safe, ask for it to be waived.  Moreover, I discovered a homeless person sleeping outside next to my car. No problem, but some people might have an issue with this. This is a beach town and homelessness is visible here.  On another note, the breakfast is not very appealing. Maybe find something better in town.

the room was comfortable with a fridge and a microwave. we walked everywhere and near sooooo many wine bars, restaurants, shops, vintage shops (we love these, we are from NYC), san clemente pier and beach. We also took uber to and from dana point and other areas and it only cost no more than 10$.  We loved this little standard hotel and would stay here again due to its proximity to everything. Also the front desk was super nice to us! this is not a fancy hotel, but we were out and about so much we did not care. the location was everything to us.

The room was clean and spacious. The mini fridge was bigger than expected - it held a few days worth of food. The breakfast they offered did not have much selection - no fruit at all the days we came in to look, but overall I think it's a decent place that is worth the lower cost.

It's my first day here and upon check in I learned the staff isn't very friendly, but I didn't expect the best. I asked for a non smoking room, and received a smoking room. The smell is pretty crappy, but overall the room is clean and what I expected from this hotel.   The location is absolutely great, within walking distance of pretty much anything you need and if you're up for maybe a mile walk it's near the beach. Beware of hills, but besides that it's great. Beautiful town.   Overall, I don't think I'll mind staying here at all. Great for the price.

Spacious room, double pained windows, fridge, microwave, safe and it's CLEAN!   The continental breakfast isn't great but there is a variety of snacks like packaged Danishes, toasted bagels with cream cheese if you wish, nutragrain bars, oj boxes, coffee or tea.  There is an elevator and plenty of parking.

Summary Heading: Reasonably Priced Walking Distance to the Beach
Summary: Arrived early on the first day of our reservation and we were offered a huge room with a balcony on the top floor of this hotel.  Parking was easy on 2 levels, and the management kindly. The deep bathtub had jacuzzi jets.  Nice!

Summary Heading: A noisy bargain in a beachside town
Summary: Son Dan and I chose this place for location and competitive pricing.  Close enough to area attractions, it was too close to a noisy highway, the busy El Camino Real. For extra noise we had rambunctious neighbors in room above us. They finally quieted down at midnight, after we phoned management.  The manager, of Indian ancestry, was helpful. He upgraded us to a room with a patio where we could enjoy cigars. We skipped the motel breakfast to go the Fisherman on the pier. Rate for night was $143 total, not bad for a tourist town.

We booked it because it was a cheaper than staying near our conference in San Juan Capistrano and it was a great idea because otherwise we would''t have a chance to know this beautiful city. Stay was nice, as expected, and would come back.

Friendly staff. Large clean rooms. Great location walking distance from the beach and just off the interstate. Breakfast left a lot to be desired. A few pastries and bagels with little juice boxes. Enough to hold me over until I can get someplace with more variety.

The exterior of the building was nice enough, interior felt very old, baseboard had a rotten place in the bathroom.  Had problems checking in with our credit card, had to call our bank to which they said it was the vendor machine malfunction.  The hotel advertised continental breakfast, but is was just a little shelf  in the very small ( maybe 10'x12' lobby) with cereal bars, instant oatmeal packets, and coffee hardly qualifies as a continental breakfast.  Thankfully we only were there one night but our friends that met us in San Clemente were there 2 nights and had trouble with the room key in there room every time they left and tried to re enter on top of the disappointing rooms.

When we arrived I discovered I had booked a smoking room by mistake. The place was pretty well booked but thanks to the manager we were able to move to a non-smoking room. The room had a fridge, micro wave and ironing board. There was under building parking. This was a good location for the time we were here.

Yes, it IS a Rodeway Inn, so what makes it very good bordering on excellent?   LOCATION: We ride the Metrolink train into San Clemente from the east; there are two stations that serve that area, one is "San Clemente", the other "San Clemente Pier."  For people who wish to do the same, if you disembark at the first, you'll be closer to this hotel, but, you'll have a 15 minute walk uphill, and we had to drag our luggage along with us.  I suppose we could've waited for a cab, but we travelled light so it wasn't that much work.  For those who arrive by car, not an issue.  From the hotel, it's about a 20-30 minute walk, first uphill, then leveling out/downhill to Avienda Del Mar, which is the main drag for downtown.  Along that walk you'll find many interesting shops and restaurants.

Summary Heading: Ok, but non-smoking room directly above to smoking room, got alot of smoke smell
Summary: Allergic to smoke and due to location of room got a lot of smoke from the room below. Was on 3rd floor and was not made aware of elevator till after my friends pointed it out after I carried my suitcases up 3 flights. Breakfast was slim pickings.

Stayed 2 nights.  The first full day we left the hotel at 9:15 a.m. and didn't return until 1:30 p.m.  We spent the time at the beach & when we returned our room STILL had not been cleaned.  I figure 3 1;/2 hours is enough time for them to clean the room knowing we were spending two nights.  Talked to the cleaning gal who was cleaning the room next to ours and she said about 10 min. & she would be cleaning our room.  We had a dinner engagement to go to that evening so we asked to at least have fresh towels so we could clean up.  We left the hotel again at 3:30 p.m., told the manager our room had not been cleaned yet and was told she already went home for the day!  sorry, but we can give you fresh towels.   We already had a pile of dirty towels,, full trash cans and unmade bed.

Summary Heading: Decent Little Spot, But Beware of Rude Staff!
Summary: Rodeway is in a prime spot on El Camino Real, just a few blocks from the heart of Downtown San Clemente. The hotel itself was very well kept. We booked a King Suite, which had an awkward layout, but plenty of space and a Jacuzzi tub in the bathroom, which wasn't even mention in the room description. The room was clean, views aren't amazing, but what really upset me was the woman at the front desk. I called ahead to see if my room was ready. She said they were cleaning it and it would be ready in 20 min. So, we made our way out of the beach and over to check in. At least 30 minutes had passed and when i get there she gave me a confused look and said oh no, it wont be ready for another hour!! Really? It was already 2:30 and check in was at 3. She claimed that the people who were

As a technician spending over 100 nights a year in a hotel room, I am always looking for a good price with little compromise on cleanliness. This hotel was perfect for both. Although this hotel is showing its age, it is well kept and very clean. The location is very close to the beach if that's your reason for staying and a short piece off the 5 if you need to travel for work. The only down side would be the proximity to the highway. Most rooms back up to a four lane that produces a little unwanted noise but nothing too bad. The breakfast was also not much to write home about with mainly assorted Danishes and breakfast bars. For the price though this place is a winner.

Great little hotel! It is so close to beautiful downtown San Clemente. It's super close to many gorgeous beaches. The rooms are super clean and big, not fancy, but great! Decent price for a great location!

Summary Heading: Great place - owners leave something to be desired....
Summary: i graded this place down one notch since the owners lack customer service skills.   the woman who checked us in was very difficult to understand.   the other guy (i think an owner) tried to tell me that BOTH keys had gone bad at the same time, rather than admit that maybe, just MAYBE, they were keyed wrong by his wife since she was the one who keyed it in the first place.  but it was a clean place in a nice location, with lots of parking.     keep the location but change upper management?

OK, I read the mix of reviews before we booked this dump.  Maybe we just had the worst room in the place but it's just nasty.  First off we arrived about 11pm and had to ring the bell.  OK, small place I'm fine with that.  Then here come Uncle Grumpy in a dirty old tee-shirt who you have to talk to behind a piece of security glass with a pass through for money etc.  The "lobby" (LOL) was over run with the smell of curry.  I like curry, but this was not pleasant.  And if you think Uncle Grumpy was happy to be disturbed think again.  You are meet with a host of "NO this or that" & "warning" signs.  Also, one I've never seen before about paying in cash and they won't accept "small face" $100's, $50's, $20's or $10's.  There are few who pay cash for lodgings any more, except... well

I gave a 5 stars because of the closeness to the beach, cleanliness but was really old building! We are not really used to this kind of hotels no hot breakfast but was OK! We stayed 2 days, i think good for people who are not picky and just need a place to stay

Not a bad place to stay for a few nights.  The room is standard but clean and well equipped with hairdryer, coffee pot, etc.  A parking garage is available for no charge.  None of the rooms have an ocean view but it can certainly be seen from the street.

I read a lot of poor reviews on the property. As it turns out, my wife and I had a good experience. The room was better than I expected.Very clean room and bathroom. The traffic noise not bad. Less than the noise in Vegas. I would recommend this to anyone. I will return.

I was in a tight spot trying to find a place to stay for the 4th of July weekend and was lucky to find this place after my first choice fell through. I priced the room, almost forgetting I have AAA, which brought the price down significantly, so I booked right away. The hotel is in a good location, a bit far for ME to walk to the pier/beach but it was close enough to see the ocean from the balcony. Check in was easy, parking was a bit cramped--as other reviewers have mentioned. But I had a spot every night I stayed. The room was a very nice size and clean. The king size bed was a little hard and my room was facing the street but I still slept soundly each night. The bathroom was very nice and clean. There's a lot of negative space which leads me to believe that it could've been

First of all parking is tight and spaces are small in outdoor and underground lots! Our room was clean and comfortable but close to the street and somewhat noisy with traffic even at night! I would stay here again and try to get a quieter room. Best of all it's within walking distance to my favorite Mexican restaurant!

I couldn't say anything bad about this hotel. Walkable into the main town and buses right outside the door. Super clean and comfortable and the price, for what it is, is awesome. They also held our bags for us while we spent our last day after check-out, at Trestles beach.

I have nothing bad to say whatsoever about this hotel.  The room was sparkling clean.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  There was free WIFI and breakfast.  I would stay at this hotel again if ever in the area.

A budget property, but good value....the room was fine, had all you needed. Staff were very good, very friendly. The included Breakfast was basic, not overly healthy, but it was included. Good parking, good wifi ....and a reasonable location

The front desk was very polite and gave us a good recommendation for a local eatery. Our room was clean...nothing fancy, but we could see the ocean from our window. On-site services are limited (vending machine) and wifi was weak. Decent value for a budget stay though.

I stayed in room 404. Non smoking King bed, mini refrigerator , microwave, ironing board, hair dryer . I like the room with a balcony. I also like the location of the hotel. Just a short walk to restaurants, bars, shopping and the beach. My only suggestion would be a clock in the room and a listing of the channels for the television. I'll be back.

Summary Heading: Okay hotel,  nothing fancy but clean
Summary: I stayed here one night late as it was the only place I found nearby.  There is nothing wrong with this hotel.  It is exactly what you expect from  Rodeway Inn.  It was a little expensive but near the beach.  The breakfast was n to very good with very limited choices but I read an earlier review that explained why.  All in all an okay stay

From the moment we stepped on the property to the moment we left, we had an incredible experience.   Lois, the incredibly funny front office server, fixed my goofed up reservation (I actually booked an assistance room when I just wanted a king bedroom). She placed us on the fourth floor - only 3 rooms there, with a patio! (Ask for rooms on the 4th - incredible.)  The room was clean, comfortable, quiet, despite facing onto the street. In fact, the General Manager, Mr. Bhakta, came into our room after our "stay over" cleaning to check that everything was cleaned. He had a small scrub brush, screwdriver and some other items to make sure no detail was undone.   I like decaf, and they had some at the desk. We asked for more towels, and they had them for us.   Check out was simple and

My husband and I stayed here for a weekend getaway. Usually Rodeways are not the greatest but this place was very clean and we slept well. Its not a place to go for a romantic getaway but it gave us a place to put our heads down for the night and that was really what we wanted. We would stay here again.

OMG! It was nasty and creepy and waaaay over priced even though it was the cheapest place in town. The room smelled of years of cigarette smoke. Old TV. Not walking distance to Main Area. I couldn't get out fast enough. I was alone and just sat in town so I didn't have to go back to the room. I put all my luggage up against door for security. Yuck! Stay at the Patriot! A very cheap surprise, great location fantastic value. Clean! Wish they had a room that night.
Manager Response: Hello Dani,   I am sorry that you had a poor experience.  Our goal is to provide our guests with a good value AND a clean place to stay.  We stay competitive in price, as you noted our lower price than competitors.  As for the location, we are 0.5 miles from North Beach and we are less than a mile to the center of town; Avenieda Del Mar and El Camino Real is 0.75 mile from our location.  I am sorry that you had the impression that this property was in the center of town; we are nearby.    I was able to look up your room and that particular room has always been a non-smoking room.  I am sorry and surprised it smelled like years of smoke.  Less than a month ago, all carpets on the property were washed and I personally checked all rooms.   If you are in the area in the future, please feel free to ask to see a room before renting it.  Our staff would be happy to show you the room, so you can see that we have clean rooms for a good value in San Clemente.  Sincerely, Sheryl

Summary Heading: Clean and well appointed room but lousy breakfast
Summary: Our room was clean and neat and had everything we could want - free wifi, nice tv, microwave, refrigerator,  ironing board and iron, hairdryer, extra blankets, etc.  The room had been nicely updated.  The bathroom was also very clean. I even liked the smell of the soap!   The one down side to staying here is the free breakfast which is almost non - existent.  I'd say just skip that and pretend it's not offered by the hotel.  For $120 per night for a couple I was very happy. This whole area is expensive and for being at the low end, the hotel was great!  I took off 1 star for the poor breakfast.
Manager Response: Hello Katie,   Thank you for your very honest review!  Our goal is to provide a clean room for a good value for the area.  I wish we could expand our breakfast, but our facility is not equipped for a larger breakfast.  We provide: OJ, Coffee, Tea, Danishes, Bagels, Cereal Bars, Oatmeal & Apples/Oranges for our guests.  Our facility is not permitted to have any open food items, hence our limited breakfast.    Thank you for choosing Rodeway Inn San Clemente for your lodging needs and we hope to see you again in the future.  Sincerely,  Sheryl

Summary: Clean room with refrigerator, microwave, iron, hair dryer. Staff was helpful. Breakfast was limited. TV was older but worked great. Great reasonable hotel in an expensive area.
Rooms were clean, organized, loved the microwave and frig.  Really helped to make it easy to bring leftovers back. I will stay here again.
The stay was very good, Management was very good with working with my night schedule. I will be back.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, great price for the location.
Summary: We stayed at this hotel from 10/25 to 11/6 on a business trip. We were on the 3rd floor, king bed. The room and bathroom looked like they had been recently renovated, and there were no issues with bugs, odors, etc.  The room was quiet, the a/c worked well, the bed was comfortable, and the coffee maker and mini-fridge worked. We did not use the microwave. The rate was the best we could find for the area, and the staff we encountered were all very nice. As noted in other reviews, the breakfast choices are limited and there is no place in the lobby to sit and eat, but trays are provided to take breakfast back to the room. We will be returning to the area on business again, and we will be staying here again.

I stayed here for 2 nights. It's an older hotel, but well taken care of. I stayed on the lower floor right off of the road, El Camino Real. Noise was not an issue at all. It's a pretty quiet street at night and my sleep was never disrupted. The bed was very nice lots of pillows, clean sheets and towels. The only complaint I have is that there was a slight smell of cigarette smoke when I first walked into the room (common with older hotels). After turning on the A/C and circulating some air, it was not a problem for me. Plenty of parking while I was there.

There were bedbugs and the staff suggested that we brought them.  They stated that they cleaned the sheets but the next night they were still there.  It is more of an issue than just cleaning the sheets and it is scary that they do not know this.  A professional is required!!!
Manager Response: Dear Brian,  Bedbugs are a serious concern and I am sincerely sorry that you had this experience at the inn.  I apologize for your experience as just switching sheets is not sufficient.  I researched further and noted a refund was provided to the individual who paid for your room the night the issue was reported.  Our pest control company was called to inspect the room and the neighboring room.  Although they did not find any evidence, a preventative treatment was applied to the room you stayed in and the neighboring room.  In addition, I reviewed the process that needs to be followed when there is a pest issue with my entire staff.  Thank you for your report and I once again I apologize for your experience.  Sincerely,  Sheryl

Summary: Front desk attandent was very friendly. Hotel is small which I like. Room was clean. Outside of building was kepted neat at all times.
Manager Response: Hello Karen,  Thank you!  Our goal is to provide clean, quiet and a comfortable stay for a reasonable price.  Best Regards, Sheryl

Summary: I called the Days Inn before arrival and they confirmed a I King Bed for 109 with AA discount. I then went over to the hotel and the guy at the reception told me he had mentioned 119 and not 109 and has only 2 BR available. When I insisted, he said he cannot do anything and there was noise on my end when we talked over the phone and I did not heard him clearly (when there was no noise). I later checked online and found that 1King BR are also available at the rate he had informed over the phone (109). I believe that we were cheated and sold a higher  priced room which is very unexpected of a hotel of Day's Inn repute.  Very disappointed.
Manager Response: Hello Tarun,   I apologize on behalf of our staff for your experience.  I will discuss this as a training point with our staff to ensure pricing and room availability is quoted as rooms are available.  Booking online or over the phone should provide you with the same rates and availability.  We hope that if you are in the San Clemente area again, you will give us a second chance.  Thanks, Sheryl

Summary: The continental breakfast was scarce....just a few items available.  The location is excellent and it's just a short drive down to the beach.  I thought it would be noisy by the street but I slept well. The back of the hotel has a large playing field so it was very quiet.
Manager Response: Hello Diane,   Thank you for your review!  I'm glad you had a nice quiet stay.  Our goal is to provide a quiet, clean and comfortable room for  a reasonable price.  We look forward to seeing you again when you are in the area.  Thanks, Sheryl

Summary: Room smell! Smoking room was booked accidently.  After 5 minutes in the room, we can’t stand the smell.  I asked the front desk to change room but she refused because one corner of the bed cover was flip opened to sit on.  Even after I have  fixed the bed.  She claims that the room was used.  I was willing to pay extra to the available more expensive room.  I was ready to checkout the time to move to a different place but stay after all since it is only a day.  Very bad attitude manager! My clothes even smell smoke after got home.  Not happy at all.   Note:  Violation of fire code - Smoke alarm was wrap with a plastic bag. - Room 114 guest.
Manager Response: Hello Chidan,  I am sincerely sorry that our staff did not accommodate your request upon immediate report of the issue.  Although I can not change your experience, I will be using this as a training issue for our staff to handle this type of situation better, especially when a guest reports an issue immediately.  Our goal is to provide a clean and comfortable room for all our guests.  Sincerely, Sheryl

Summary Heading: Adequate. The breakfast offerings are very few and there is...
Summary: Adequate. The breakfast offerings are very few and there is little or no space to eat near to the food.  I will use another nearby motel/hotel as my first choice, but this would serve as a backup if the other is full.
Manager Response: Hello Karen,  Yes, our breakfast is limited to a continental selection of danishes, bagels, cereal bars, oatmeal, apples, oranges, coffee, tea, and apple and orange juice served in the lobby.  I am glad to hear that overall your stay was adequate.    We do our best to keep our prices competitive for our amenities and a good value for our guests.  Thank you for choosing to stay with us and we hope to see you again in the near future.    Best Regards, Sheryl

Summary: This was a great room for what we needed.  We hope next time to get a non-smokers room, the bagels and juice was good start to our morning walks along the beach (San Clemente Pier)  The staff was nice and there was plenty of parking, nice area, we got to see the local kids play in the park across the street...nice treat:)  We were there from 08/07 to 08/14/2013, we will be staying there again soon...I hope!
Manager Response: Hello REYNA01,   I am pleased to hear you had a great stay with us and a great vacation.  It is nice to be a short distance from the beach!  If you are in the area again, please reserve a room with us directly, as we will be able to guarantee you a non-smoking room upon reservation.   We look forward to seeing you again soon!  Sincerely,  Sheryl

Summary Heading: Second time visiting this property.  This is a great...
Summary: Second time visiting this property.  This is a great location and affordable for the Dana Point area.
Manager Response: Hello Allen,   Thanks for being a repeat customer.  We look forward to seeing you again when you are in the area.  Best Regards, Sheryl

Summary: This Days Inn is clean and in a great location for strolling downtown shops and  easy access to the 5 freeway. For a modest and no frills motel stay, this Days Inn is a good stop for the night. However it's too pricey for the quality of accommodations. I recommend it for those who need a respite during their travels but not for those who as looking for vacation lodging.
Manager Response: Hello Lisa,   Thank you for your review.  It is good to keep evaluating our location as we strive to be a clean, comfortable and a good value for our guests based on our location and amenities offered.    Thank you for staying with us during your visit to San Clemente.  Best Regards, Sheryl

Summary Heading: This place is located in a great location in San Clemente...
Summary: This place is located in a great location in San Clemente.  A good choice for a place to stay if you just want a place to wind down at he end of a long day and/ or to get some sleep. Beds could be a bit more comfortable and breakfast selection could be improved.
Manager Response: Hello Jose,   Thank you for choosing to stay with us.  It is nice to be less than a mile from the beach.  Our goal is to provide a clean, comfortable room for a reasonable price.  If you are in the area again, many of the beds have been replaced.    As for breakfast, since we do not have a separate breakfast room available, it will continue to be in the lobby and serve danishes, bagels, oatmeal, cereal bars, apples, oranges, coffee, tea and apple and orange juice.  Unfortunately we do not have the space to expand our breakfast further.    We do pride ourselves in cleanliness and value for the location and hope to see you again in the future.  Best Regards, Sheryl

Summary Heading: Very clean room and not too far from the beach.
Summary: The room was very clean, the free breakfast had a good variety and the hotel is pretty close to the beach.  The beds were very comfortable and the air conditioning worked great. We definitely would stay there again.
Manager Response: I am glad to hear you had a great experience and would stay with us again.  Thank you for your feedback and we look forward to seeing you the next time you are in the area.  Sincerely,  Sheryl

Summary Heading: Do not go to this motel expecting to get breakfast & then...
Summary: Do not go to this motel expecting to get breakfast & then having a place to sit down and eat!  The breakfast offerings was strictly a "continental" breakfast, and you have to it that in your room!
Manager Response: Hello Ralph,   Yes, I agree that the breakfast is continental and we try not to promote a breakfast as having more.  Unfortunately, we do no have a breakfast room available on property, therefore we serve as many items as we can in our lobby for our continental breakfast, consisting of a variety of danishes and cereal bars, bagels, oatmeal, apples, oranges, coffee, tea, and apple and orange juice boxes.  I am glad that you found our hotel to be clean and in a good location.  Sincerely,  Sheryl

Summary Heading: Hotel 1.5 miles from sea and pier
Summary: Had little option but to book up due to rental properties hopeless method of booking direct. Had a low expectancy. Was fine.  At San Clemente, all you need to do is to roll up at the beach and enjoy yourself. Hotel has to be minimal requirement. Everything was average there to be honest. Internet sucked big time so not for a business traveller. Breakfast was a bit scant.  Its a budget hotel and the facilities in the room were fine.
Manager Response: Good news!  We have changed our wi-fi network!   It will continue to be free to all of our guests, but it is faster and does not drop the connection like it did before.   We will continue to strive to be a good value for our guests, by providing a clean and comfortable stay for a reasonable price.  It is nice bonus to be walking distance to the beach!  Thanks! Sheryl

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: The room was fair. Nothing fancy. Bed shower tv refrig and micro oh and a/c. Morning breakfast was lame. The parking was limited too. Lobby? Nothing to it bit a couple of chairs and a counter.  i would recommend this hotel if your on a tight budget and are not looking for luxury
Manager Response: Lynne K,   Yes, this location is not a luxury hotel, but our goal is to provide a clean and comfortable room for a good value for all our guests.  I hope we were able to accomplish this and if in the future you need a clean room for a good price, we look forward to having you stay with us.  There are a handful of rooms that are quite spacious, but for the most part we are a standard hotel, with some minor upgrades.  The lobby area is just barely big enough to place out a continental breakfast for our guests to be able to take items to go or to the room.  Thanks, Sheryl

Summary: I had a pleasant experience here.  For a decent rate I reserved a suite.  It turned out to be one of the best hotel rooms I've ever stayed in.  The room was clean and spacious.  There was even a small Jacuzzi in the bathroom.  My only (minor) complaints are that the refrigerator did not seem to be working well and there was no computer available for guest use.  Also, the hotel is right on a major street, so traffic noise can be a little loud.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recommendation.  I am glad to hear that you had a great experience.  The suites are quite spacious, I have to agree!  If you are staying with us again and for some reason have the same issue with the refrigerator, please let us know.  I would like try to get it fixed (if it is just a reset) or swap it out right away.    Thank you, Sheryl

Summary Heading: Fine hotel. We were there from only 7pm to 7am the next...
Summary: Fine hotel. We were there from only 7pm to 7am the next morning. Disappointed thno pool, but glad the room & bathrooms were was clean
Manager Response: I am happy to hear you had a nice and clean experience, we strive to provide a clean, quiet, and a good value for our customers.  I wish we had space to put in a pool too!   Thanks, Sheryl

Summary Heading: Good times @ the beach in January
Summary: My friend and I had a great first time experience and felt comfortable with the accommodations.  Perfect location for shopping, restaurants and beach activities.  Hopefully, will book again this summer.
Manager Response: Thank you!  We look forward to having you stay with us again!

Summary Heading: non smoking room smelled like smoke
Summary: We got a great AAA rate. $90 with tax for a friday night, but the room smelled pretty bad. The worker said that people smoke near and in the rooms and not much you can do to control it. If you want a cheap stay and dont care....its great. Walking distance from the downtown san clemente shops and dining.   Wasnt great, but i knew what i was paying for.
Manager Response: Dear Audra R.  I can understand your frustration, therefore I will be asking our clerks to kindly request smokers to not smoke in front of non-smoking rooms.  We can also open windows to circulate in fresh clean air and use air neutralizers to counteract the smoke.    My goal is to provide customers with a good value (which includes having a proper non-smoking room).  Thank you for your feedback and if you are in the area in the future, I hope we can provide you with a "non-smoking" room for a great value.  Thanks, Sheryl

Summary Heading: Every stay has been a pleasant one with the staff improving...
Summary: Every stay has been a pleasant one with the staff improving it more so by making the initial reservation for each stay hassle-free and allowing me flexibility with my arrival times. Always accommodating and cheerful.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback and choosing Days Inn San Clemente for your lodging!

Summary: The room was just average the continental breakfast was marginal at best.  The in-room coffee make had no carafe and the manager said there was none and I should hold the cup under the basket.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback regarding your stay.    Please let me clarify about coffeee makers; all of the rooms have single-cup coffee makers.  The cup is to be placed on the base of the coffeemaker, where the coffee will drip directly into the cup.   A new coffee pod would be used per cup of coffee made.  Therefore, there are no in-room coffee pots or carafes, only coffee makers, coffee, cups and condiments.  In regards to our breakfast, the following items should be well stocked: Coffee, Lipton Tea, Juice (Orange and Apple), Oatmeal, Cereal Bars, Danishes, Bagels and Cream Cheese, Juice (Orange and Apple), and Fresh Fruit (Oranges and Apples).  Unfortunately, we do not have enough space for a hot breakfast.    If you are in the area again, we hope that you will find our location to be a good value for the price.  Sincerely, Sheryl

Summary: Nice hotel. Nothing fancy but it has a refrigerator, microwave and coffee pot. Also a little breakfast.
Manager Response: We hope to see you again in the future and please let us know if we can help you with anything during your stay with us at Days Inn of San Clemente.

Summary: The room was beneath a stairwell so the room did not get much natural light. The staff and cleanliness are what you'd expect from a BW. The location was totally boss! Walking distance to beach, bars and restaurants.
Manager Response: Thank you!  We look forward to seeing you again during your next visit to San Clemente.

Summary: A good stay for Days Inn. Nice, clean hotel with good beds. However the breakfast was disappointing with only a few items and poorly stocked.
Manager Response: Glad to hear you had a an overall good stay.  Thank you for your feedback on the breakfast.  I will make a note for our staff to properly stock the items that we do provide.  We do not have enough space in the lobby for a hot breakfast, but the following items should be well stocked:  Coffee, Lipton Tea, Juice (Orange and Apple), Oatmeal, Cereal Bars, Danishes, Bagels and Cream Cheese, Juice (Orange and Apple), and Fresh Fruit (Oranges and Apples).

Summary: This hotel met our needs. We were in town for a family memorial service.  We needed a place to sleep and shower.  The rooms were adequate and it was quiet.  The front desk service left a little to be desired.  The person at the front desk was just shy of being rude and did not offer up anything he did not have to! The continental breakfast was barely coffee and packaged sweet rolls.  We were able to find a packaged cereal bar to take with us.  Like I said--it met our needs. We are not likely however to return to this hotel.
Manager Response: Glad that the room condition met your needs for this stay.  Thank you for your feedback on the breakfast and staff.  I will make a note for our breakfast to be stocked and our staff to offer assistance for our guests. We do not have enough space in the lobby for a hot breakfast, but the following items should be well stocked:  Coffee, Lipton Tea, Juice (Orange and Apple), Oatmeal, Cereal Bars, Danishes, Bagels and Cream Cheese, Juice (Orange and Apple), and Fresh Fruit (Oranges and Apples).

Summary: check it out, needed a room for an overnight stay, probably no more then a few hours of sleep, and a couple of showers.  Didn't arrive till almost 11p, and left at 530a, to work a fast pitch softball tournament qualifier up at Steed Park, the owner/manager Chuck greeted me warmly, explained where everything was located at the hotel, From what I could see the exterior was well maintained, rooms super clean even for a smokers room. and as I said Chuck treated me almost like family.  Thank You, a little pricey for me for just a few hours, but still the lowest motel in the area, hope I can get same rate later in the summer, when I return for another tournament, and an upcoming class reunion/golf tournament at San Clemente Municipal next month.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing Days Inn San Clement for your lodging needs.  We hope you will stay with us again during your future stays.

Summary: Hotel was a little dated. It's a great price for the location! Even new sheets and paint would make a
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts regarding your experience at Days Inn – San Clemente, CA.  I will be reviewing your feedback with Housekeeping and Maintenance to ensure we resolve these concerns.  I apologize for the “Eh” experience and we will fix that, while continuing to provide you and our guests with “a great price for the location!"  Thank you for your feedback.

Summary: Has it all. Fridge, microwave , coffee pot, safe, hair dryer. Continental breakfast. We stay here a lote
Manager Response: Thank you for your review!  We appreciate you choosing Days Inn – San Clemente!

Summary: This hotel is a great value for San Clemente.  The rooms are clean and well equipped.  The hotel is nothing fancy but it works for a place to sleep and clean up.  They do have coffee and light breakfast in the morning and it was nice to be able to slip downstairs for coffee early without seeking out a coffee house.  Both of the front desk clerks were kind of strange; not impolite but not friendly.  Hard to get a read on them.  They did their job and that was about it; not much hospitality. All things considered, I would stay there again.  It worked!  If you don't need a lot of ambiance but value cleanliness and location; this is a great hotel for you. If you ask for a room with a view, they can try to get you towards the north end of the building where you can get a small view
Manager Response: Thank you for providing a thorough review of the Days Inn – San Clemente.  Your feedback is valuable to us.  I am glad to hear that your overall stay was clean and pleasant.  We will work on our front desk clerks providing a more hospitable interaction with our guests.  We look forward to seeing you again at the Days Inn – San Clemente when you are in the area!

Summary Heading: The worst breakfast I have ever seen
Summary: I have stayed in lots of hotels and this was the worst breakfast I have ever seen. Great location. Good bed, but the most sour lady checking us in. I could not get that gal to smile for the life of me!
Manager Response: Thank you for your providing your feedback on your experience at the Days Inn – San Clemente.  Our breakfast will now include coffee, orange juice, apple juice, tea, bagels and cream cheese, oatmeal, cereal bars, danishes, apples, and oranges; unfortunately we will not be able to provide a hot breakfast for our guests at this time.  We can definitely provide a friendly smile to all of our guests!

Summary: Room was big, bright, cheery and very clean.  The beds were so comfortable, for our 2 night stay. Good size fridge and microwave, and I used them both for pizza. The continental breakfast was delicious with GREAT coffee.  Lois on duty when we checked in at 8pm, and she was a delight.  Very friendly, helpful, with suggestions, and even gave us a map of the town.  Will definitely come back.  What a value!!!!
Manager Response: Thank you!  We look forward to seeing you again!

Summary: I was very pleased with our hotel in San Clemente.    The room was very clean and all new bathroom fixtures.   The beds were very comfortable and seemed new also.   The decor of the room was pleasant and seemed new and clean. The people at the desk were very helpful and kind.   Also, they went out of their way to give us a room in a quiet location as we had asked.
Manager Response: We very much appreciate your review - Thank you!  We hope to see you again at the Days Inn - San Clemente, CA on your next trip.

Summary Heading: Handicapped room:  was able to get around with pwr chair...
Summary: Handicapped room:  was able to get around with pwr chair, but otherwise not for handicapped.  No risers on toilet, sink too high, no stall shower, grab bars too far away.  Tea bags abt 50 yrs old, no sam

Even though the room was non-smoking it still reeked of old smoke.  A fragrance was used to cover it up but this make it worse as the smell made it hard to breathe.  I asked the manager for another room but was told that they were all like that; he then offered me more fragrance spray if I wanted it.  Good location - close to Del Mar shopping/restaurant area.

We knew the hotel would just be a place to sleep, but it was even worse than I thought it would be.  When we arrived at the hotel, they told us we had a smoking room.  We asked for a non-smoking and 2 queen beds.  He told us it was extra for 2 queens.  We travel frequently, and hotels always ask do you want a king or 2 queens no price difference.  We only needed 2 queen bed because my husband has a broken foot and it has been easier for him to sleep in his own bed.  We said forget it, just give us the king.  My step-mom asked if it was a franchise hotel or individually owned.  That is all that was said.  My dad then went to check in, and the man at the desk said how racist we were.  Seriously?????  Nothing we said had anything remotely racist/negative.  The hotel was clean, but

Summary Heading: Non-Smokers love an Ocean View Also
Summary: Overall it was a great stay.  I couldn't believe that all the great ocean views were for smokers.  I went into one of the rooms to see if we could switch but the room had a stale odor of cigarette smoke.  All the rooms that were available with the ocean view were for smokers unfortunately,

Our California trip started a day early on a whim after my boyfriend said he didn't have to work. Leaving early on Saturday morning, we both didn't check to set a place up and figured we would just locate a place while driving to San Clemente from Tucson (Our original destination was San Diego). My boyfriend wanted to take me to where his family vacations every year, which is where we were headed. We decided to look for a place after hitting Alpine, California for lunch. Once there, he pulled up expedia and I - pulled up tripadvisor to see where would be a decent place. We saw the Days Inn and promply called - the rate was a decent one. Not only was the lady nice who answered but she offered the different rooms available. We got a room, last minute for less than 100.00. We

After a long hot drive down from Santa Barbara we were looking forward to getting to SC and relaxing. We had booked ahead to avoid any stress of having to find a place on our arrival - which turned out to be a mistake.   The receptionist (a lady who appeared to be living at the hotel) was rude from the start, greeting us with 'what do you want?'. She then couldn't find our reservation which we were totally cool with, but didn't get any apology for. The icing on the cake was when we returned later to ask if they had any maps of the local area. She pointed at a map on the wall next to me and said 'we have have that one' (in a slightly off tone), before muttering something then pulling out a map from a draw and saying 'you can have this but if you get lost I wont help you'.   We

Summary Heading: You get for what you pay for and a little more
Summary: Pleasant. Good price. It's clean and the receptionist was eager to help.   I would come back here on a budget.   Right now so quiet.

The location is good close to Dana Point the hotel is no frills.  If you are looking for a place just to sleep that is not expensive then this is the motel for you.  We slept, got up and checked out ASAP.

Summary Heading: Very nice laid back motel close to the ocean
Summary: The rooms were wel lkept. We had maid service every day at a time convenient to us. The room had a nice balcony.  Continental breakfast was ok.

Summary Heading: Hope you don't get this hotel through hotwire
Summary: We had to book a room quickly for that night after having to check out of another hotel unexpectedly. I booked on hotwire and got this hotel. i called ahead and the manager graciously let us check in 2.5 hours early which was greatly appreciated. Once I arrived however, the manager seemed very upset that we had booked on hotwire and told me that hotwire takes $30 and it was too bad because if I had called him and booked directly I could've gotten the room for $65. I explained that I had to book something quickly and was unfamiliar with the area. When my boyfriend asked if we could get that rate if we wanted to stay an additional night, he became very argumentative and said there were no rooms available the next night. He gave us our room key and I saw that it was on the corner,

This hotel met all of our requirements - clean, safe neighborhood, quiet, free breakfast and reasonably priced.    It wasn't anything super fancy, but it was more than reasonable for what we got.  My ultimate compliment - I felt comfortable walking on the carpet in my bare feet.  That's rare!  The breakfast was adequate - juice, decent coffee, bagels in plastic bags, sweet rolls in plastic bags, apples, oranges, instant oatmeal, etc.  Not big on whole grains, so we bought a loaf of bread and some peanut butter, and used their toaster each morning.  With the juice and fresh fruit, it was fine.  I would return again - and recommend it if you're in the market for a no-frills, but perfectly adequate place to stay.

There were some not-so-great aspects of this hotel, I stayed for 2 nights in September. I reserved a non-smoking room through Orbitz and the manager said nope, only smoking rooms were left (yack!). I will say this, he put me in a "smoking" room on the top floor that was totally clean smelling, so... that worked out for me, but be wary.  Also, the manager railed against how Orbitz cheats them, etc etc etc. Very bad vibe I got.  The common areas were non-existant. This is a very very basic hotel. I had a bad experience with kids running around on walkways outside my door waking me up more than once... (and I've schlepped my share of low-end hotels, dont get me wrong, I know you can have some good tenants or questionable tenants with the luck of the draw). The hotel has kind of a

Just returned from a one night stay at the Days Inn in San Clemente.  The room certainly wasn't luxurious (it IS a Days Inn after all), but was very clean and comfortable.  The folks who run the place are very accomodating.  In all, a decent place to stay at a decent price.

Summary Heading: Great location, excellent value, clean rooms, good wi-fi
Summary: I stayed at this hotel June 18-19 and again on June 25-26.  My experience was quite different for each stay - the rating of "4" is a blend of the two stays.  The first stay was wonderful.  I booked well in advance and had a very spacious king suite located in the corner of the top floor. it was a wonderful room at a great price.  The second stay was a last minute booking on a Friday-Saturday and I think I got their last room.  It was on the ground floor, and even though it was a non-smoking room, it definitely smelled like stale smoke.  The price was quite good, but I did not enjoy my time in the room very much.  Fortunately, it is in a great location - an easy walk to the beach and the town center - so I didn't spend much time in the room.  The wi-fi reception was quite good in

I stayed for a week and a half here, and liked the room. When I reserved online, I asked for a room with a glimpse of the ocean view if possible, and they gave me a room on the top floor where I could just see the ocean down the street (which is the best view you could reasonably get there), so I was happy with that. The place was clean, and the cleaners came every day and did a great job. The traffic from the road below caused a little noise during the day, but it wasn't bad at all. There were kids' sports teams about every other day at the park across the way, so some noise from there, but again not bad. The manager was easy to work with it, and it was easy to extend my stay one day. Overall, the place wasn't fancy or anything, but it was a good, decent place and I would stay

I came to San Clement to visit relatives, and I was very pleased with my choice. The staff was friendly and helpful, and the room fresh, spacious and clean. The location is convenient and quiet, and parking very adequate. The breakfast was basic but nice - natural hot cereals, cold cereals, danish, muffins, milk, beverages, fruit bars, and fresh fruit; and the coffee was teriffic. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again or recommend this Days Inn to anyone visiting SC.

I commute from Los Angeles, and sometimes just need a break from the traffic.  Stayed at this motel.  Desk person, was quite friendly, and the room was suprisingly clean, with the exception of some ants.  Quiet and affordable.  I will stay here again.
I wouldn't recommend it to anyone.  Rude Management and dirty rooms!
